meanings.definition: To become more relaxed or calm.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, she found herself mellowing on the cozy couch.
meanings.sent2: The music was mellowing, creating a soothing atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be mellowing out after chasing its tail for hours.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the colors of the sky were mellowing into a beautiful blend.
meanings.sent5: The tea was mellowing in the cup, releasing a comforting aroma.

meanings.definition: To soften in flavor or texture.
meanings.sent1: The cheese was mellowing, making it perfect for the sandwich.
meanings.sent2: The spices in the stew were mellowing, creating a delicious aroma.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream was mellowing, ready to be scooped into a cone.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the painting were mellowing together, creating a harmonious blend.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the flowers was mellowing, filling the room with a gentle fragrance.

meanings.definition: The process of aging or maturing.
meanings.sent1: The mellowing of the wine gave it a rich and complex flavor.
meanings.sent2: The mellowing of the cheese enhanced its taste and texture.
meanings.sent3: The mellowing of the wood in the furniture added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent4: The mellowing of the friendship over the years deepened their bond.
meanings.sent5: The mellowing of the fruit on the tree signaled the arrival of a bountiful harvest.
